text:
Schroeder in 2014

Nastassia Bianca Schroeder (born June 24, 1988[1]) is an American television personality, podcast host, fashion blogger, model and author.[2] She is best known for her role on the reality television series Vanderpump Rules.[3][4]

Early life [ edit ]

Nastassia Schroeder was born in New Orleans, Louisiana, to an architect father, Mark, and a jewelry designer (Georgi Jules Jewelry) mother, Dayna. She has two younger brothers, Hunter and Nikolai, and a younger sister, Georgianna. Her grandmother, Rosemary died at age 95 in May 2019.[5] When she was 11, Schroeder began taking theater classes at her local high school, Mount Carmel Academy. She was the president of the drama club during her senior year of high school and was voted "Most Talented" by her senior class in 2006.[5] When she turned 18, she moved to Hollywood and attended Loyola Marymount University, where she earned a Bachelor's degree in English writing.[6]

Career [ edit ]

Television [ edit ]

In 2005, Schroeder appeared as a contestant on the reality game show The Amazing Race, alongside her father Mark, her step-mother Char, and her brother Hunter.[7] After the filming of the show, the Schroeders' house was flooded and destroyed by Hurricane Katrina. They stayed with another family from the show while they rebuilt their house.[8]

While going to school in 2008, she was on the television series Queen Bees.[9] In 2010, she started working at Lisa Vanderpump's restaurants SUR and Villa Blanca, which earned her a spot on the reality television series Vanderpump Rules. The series follows Vanderpump's employees, as they work on building their futures and become entangled in interpersonal drama.[10] It is a spin-off from The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills, also starring Vanderpump. In 2016, she portrayed Koening in the television film Sharknado: The 4th Awakens. She has also appeared on three episodes of Bravo's reality television series Summer House between 2017 and 2019.[11]

Fashion [ edit ]

Schroeder worked as a model for several years, appearing in magazines like Italian Vanity Fair, 944, and Us Weekly.[12] Schroeder introduced a capsule collection with accessories e-retailer ShopPrimadonna.com which officially launched in December 2014.[13] She released a clothing line in collaboration with JustFab in July 2019.[14][15] The collection has two parts "Next Level Basics" and "#OOTN (Outfit of the Night)".[16][17][18]

Writing [ edit ]

Schroeder worked as a style critic writing for Vanderpump‘s daughter’s website, The Divine Addiction.[16] Schroeder's book Next Level Basic: The Definitive Basic Bitch Handbook was released on April 16, 2019 by Gallery Books.[19][20][21][22] The book was third on the New York Times Best Seller list.[23]

Other ventures [ edit ]

In 2019, Schroeder, Kristen Doute and Katie Maloney-Schwartz released a wine collection called "Witches of WeHo".[24][25]

She hosts a weekly podcast titled Straight Up with Stassi.[26] Schroeder announced that she is doing "Straight Up With Stassi LIVE" podcast tour in four cities in September 2019.[27]
